Bradford township Chester county, Penn at the house Of
Amos Fling. MARGARET WATSON, at the advanced
age of one hundred and six years and months Her
health was generally good and until the last four or FIVE
years she had been able procure her livelihood by
tery she was indebted to the county for her
Her illness was sortand she sensible until the cur
tain of death closed the She buried Friends
Burial CT ound in West Bradford.

neghbor he possessed that lively Of honor.
berality Of sentiment. warmth Of heart frankness and

1t hss been matter Of debate whether Mr.. Sam
uel Harker 80 more distinguished as logician, a
critic on poetry and grammar, peeper at the Pcnin4
sula or . great political prophet. While it would
Be doing great injustice to deny him superior ex.
ceencs in each Of these characters, he seems to be
prestninenty distinguished for his prophecies rela-
tive to Presidental matters. The improbability of
their fulhlment. and the total destruction OF all
his visions and fances cannot deter him from telling
mankind what will be the s,sie Of Presidential af-
fairs in future. There is certainly, however, one
advantage pereeptble in these visions Of our mod
ern Samuel: We can discover the mans wishes,
even though time makes such havoc of his fancies
His latest Presidential prophecy is the following in
the Gazette Of the Goth instant.

upon without making allowances in his favor where there
but Le for them the would stand for

DIED-On Third Day, the 2sth of LIST Month, in West
Bradford township Chester county, Penn at the house Of
Amos Fling. MARGARET WATSON, at the advanced
age of one hundred and six years and months Her
health was generally good and until the last four or FIVE
years she had been able procure her livelihood by
tery she was indebted to the county for her
Her illness was sortand she sensible until the cur
tain of death closed the She buried Friends
Burial CT ound in West Bradford.

AT his residence near Smyrna, on the 14lh inst.
SEWELL GREEN, Esq. in the 68th year Of his age. 1:
may truly be said Of the deceased ta. he lived respected
and died lamented by all who knew him. Exclusive Of
his attention \ husband, his indulgence father, his
kindness a MASTER and his accommodating disposition
neghbor he possessed that lively Of honor.
berality Of sentiment. warmth Of heart frankness and
- In Centrevle, Md, on the 18th inst. in the 22d
wear Of her age, Mrs MARGARET ANN HOPPER, con,
sort Of Philemon Hopper Esq. Associate Judge Of The
I'd Judicial district vi Maryland.

For deiraynR the expenses incidental to making

seys for the purposes Of Internal Improvement

was upset in the Delaware, about two miles above
this Borough. and all on board, four men, were
drowned. The dis'rss,ing scene was Witnessed BY

we're unable to render any relief IN consequence Of
their boats having become SO dry by being laid up
during the winter, rs TO be unit for service. We
have not heard where the boat was from, or the
names OF her unfortunate crew, but it ID supposed
they we're fishermen from Philadelphia.

That he ~ of energy, one will doubt. but we

much energy extremely dnnyreus AND we have seen IN

full articles.article:
1t hss been matter Of debate whether Mr.. Sam
uel Harker 80 more distinguished as logician, a
critic on poetry and grammar, peeper at the Pcnin4
sula or . great political prophet. While it would
Be doing great injustice to deny him superior ex.
ceencs in each Of these characters, he seems to be
prestninenty distinguished for his prophecies rela-
tive to Presidental matters. The improbability of
their fulhlment. and the total destruction OF all
his visions and fances cannot deter him from telling
mankind what will be the s,sie Of Presidential af-
fairs in future. There is certainly, however, one
advantage pereeptble in these visions Of our mod
ern Samuel: We can discover the mans wishes,
even though time makes such havoc of his fancies
His latest Presidential prophecy is the following in
the Gazette Of the Goth instant.

upon without making allowances in his favor where there
but Le for them the would stand for
